p: After 15 days of incubation, the rectal content of each specimen was obtained by abdominal compression and examined by direct observation to confirm the presence of T. cruzi blood trypomastigotes [ 45]. A drop of PBS 1× pH 7.2 (Na 2HPO 4 8 × 10 −6 M, KH 2PO 4 10 −6 M, KCl 3 × 10 −6 M, NaCl 10 −4 M) was placed on a glass slide. A drop of triatomine rectal content was added and the mixture was homogenized [ 45]. A 10-μl aliquot was taken and microscopically observed under a 40× objective (Olympus CH-2, Center Valley, PA, USA).
